alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 27 at 8:28AM EDT until May 27 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR WESTERN MONTGOMERY AND CENTRAL RANDOLPH COUNTIES... At 828 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Asheboro, Randleman, Ulah, Eldorado, Morrow Mountain State Park, Randleman Regional Reservior Marina, Lake Tillery and Uwharrie Haven. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
